column1: If the plaintiff’s proxy is defective, the Court cannot unilaterally dismiss
the plaintiff’s action on that ground. A defect in the proxy is not fatal but
rather curable unless there is a positive legal bar.

The  question  of  defective  proxy  has  been  addressed 
in  numerous
In Udeshi and Others v. Mather [1988] 1 Sri LR 12, the Supreme Court
authoritatively  held  that,  in  the  absence  of  a  positive  legal  bar,  the
defective proxy can be cured. Atukorale J. held at page 21:
